meanings.definition: The quality or state of being inviolable.
meanings.sent1: The inviolability of the ancient artifacts was crucial for preserving our history.
meanings.sent2: The inviolability of the treaty ensured peace between the two nations.
meanings.sent3: The inviolability of the cake in the fridge was tested by the mischievous siblings.
meanings.sent4: Her inviolability in matters of trust made her a reliable confidante.
meanings.sent5: The inviolability of the fortress walls stood as a symbol of strength and protection.

meanings.definition: The condition of being secure from violation or profanation.
meanings.sent1: The inviolability of the temple was respected by all visitors.
meanings.sent2: The inviolability of the data was crucial for maintaining confidentiality.
meanings.sent3: The inviolability of the 'Do Not Disturb' sign was comically ignored by the persistent housekeeper.
meanings.sent4: The inviolability of her personal space was like an invisible shield around her.
meanings.sent5: The inviolability of the secret garden added an air of mystery to the estate.
